lexUnit.name: impersonate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pretend to be (another person) for entertainment or fraud

sentence.text: Even Rory Bremner would have been hard pressed to impersonate more roles in a single show .
Miss Menzies suddenly stood up , looked him straight in the eyes and said , ` Do you know it 's a very serious offence to impersonate a police officer ? "
The underdog cuts off her glamourous tresses for " serious hair " and begins to impersonate the boss .
It is hard to imagine the glamorous Deborah Moggach impersonating a decrepit roué , but that is what she says she did while writing The Ex-Wives ( £14.99 ) , coming from Heinemann on 29th April .
At the ritual earlier Tao Chu had impersonated Tsu Tiao , playing out scenes from the old T'ang 's life before the watching Court .
In one city he had been impersonated by a woman named Helen Potter , and in another a boy of sixteen managed to get into his hotel room .
Mark Curry is well aware he 's following some illustrious predecessors in the role of Lord Fancourt , who dons a frock to impersonate a long-lost aunt from Brazil ( where the nuts come from ) .
` So this Alfred Emblow steps forward , " she went on , deepening her voice a tone to impersonate the strong-man , ` and says : ` Well done , young man .
Many County supporters believed the interview , in which the England international was impersonated by Radio Nottingham 's sports presenter , Martin Fisher .
Some soldier saw me , realized I was n't a real major and I suppose he thought I was impersonating an officer or whatever .
That has meant impersonating the Philadelphia Eagles quarterback to help the 49ers prepare for Sunday 's match .
It could be a trick , an impression ( we 've heard of a dog who impersonates an anteater ! ) it 's up to you .
In the end it is left to Dickson McCunn to further the romantic element of the book when he impersonates the chosen royal candidate , the elderly and ailing Archduke Hadrian .
I think the turning point came when Chris Patten and Michael Heseltine joked at a press conference on Tuesday , with Mr Heseltine impersonating Neil Kinnock .
The actors impersonate the totem animal , thus identifying and promoting a resonant connection with it .
` It could n't possibly have been Eddie who impersonated Delia and anyway there 'd have been no point when she lives in the same house as Angy . "
First , could somebody be impersonating a member ?
Sir Peter Teazle suggests to Sir Oliver Surface that he impersonates this Mr Premium whom Charles had never met , and ` you 'll see your nephew in all his glory " .
They ask me to impersonate Michael fucking Caine , can you believe that ?
He was probably an actor she had hired to impersonate one .
